page.title: 16LANDSCAPE
page.content: To the north of the M50 on this blocks eastern edge,25% is coniferous woodland owned by the Foresty Commision.The land rises westwards. There is a Golf Course and many farms. The villages of Upton Crews and Upton Bishop are on the west.Upton Court Estate,which is known as one of the best agricultural properties in the south of the county comprises a fine five bed,Grade II period residence, two cottages and 411 acres of grade II and III land including 18 acres of woodland.It forms a fine shoot. South of the Motorway to the east is Gorsley Common, now separated into small fields of pasture for cattle, criss crossed by many lanes,with homes of the non nucleated Gorsley village. Linton ridge and village(Norman) lie to the west.Large man made lakes with Salmon+Trout lie beyond at Hartleton.
